I've already search the bugzilla found several entries with the same looking stack trace but no resolution or explanation of the problem.

It is always reproducible it happens two/three times a day.

Something is leaking.  Do you have any additional plugins installed?
Is there any way you can test with the version of Eclipse from
eclipse.org rather than from Ubuntu?

The application 'xrestop' can be used to monitor Eclipse's X
resource usage.  Try running this application and using Eclipse, and
see if you can find out what operation is creating a lot of GCs or
pixmaps and  never destroying them.
I've seen this one as well in Eclipse 3.3.1 (just using the PDE).
